member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyRequest
member.summary: Base class for Polly operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.DeleteLexiconRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteLexicon operation. Deletes the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. A lexicon which has been deleted is not available for speech synthesis, nor is it possible to retrieve it using either the GetLexicon or ListLexicon APIs.
For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.DeleteLexiconRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the lexicon to delete. Must be an existing lexicon in the region.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.DeleteLexiconResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteLexicon operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeVoices operation. Returns the list of voices that are available for use when requesting speech synthesis. Each voice speaks a specified language, is either male or female, and is identified by an ID, which is the ASCII version of the voice name.
When synthesizing speech ( SynthesizeSpeech ), you provide the voice ID for the voice you want from the list of voices returned by DescribeVoices.
For example, you want your news reader application to read news in a specific language, but giving a user the option to choose the voice. Using the DescribeVoices operation you can provide the user with a list of available voices to select from.
You can optionally specify a language code to filter the available voices. For example, if you specify en-US, the operation returns a list of all available US English voices.
This operation requires permissions to perform the polly:DescribeVoices action.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language identification tag (ISO 639 code for the language name-ISO 3166 country code) for filtering the list of voices returned. If you don't specify this optional parameter, all available voices are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
An opaque pagination token returned from the previous DescribeVoices operation. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeVoices operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of voices. NextToken is returned only if the response is truncated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesResponse.Voices
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Voices.
A list of voices with their properties.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetLexicon operation. Returns the content of the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Name of the lexicon.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetLexicon operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconResponse.Lexicon
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lexicon.
Lexicon object that provides name and the string content of the lexicon.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconResponse.LexiconAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LexiconAttributes.
Metadata of the lexicon, including phonetic alphabetic used, language code, lexicon ARN, number of lexemes defined in the lexicon, and size of lexicon in bytes.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.Lexicon
member.summary: Provides lexicon name and lexicon content in string format. For more information, see Pronunciation Lexicon Specification (PLS) Version 1.0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.Lexicon.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
Lexicon content in string format. The content of a lexicon must be in PLS format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.Lexicon.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Name of the lexicon.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes
member.summary: Contains metadata describing the lexicon such as the number of lexemes, language code, and so on. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes.Alphabet
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Alphabet.
Phonetic alphabet used in the lexicon. Valid values are ipa and x-sampa.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
Language code that the lexicon applies to. A lexicon with a language code such as "en" would be applied to all English languages (en-GB, en-US, en-AUS, en-WLS, and so on.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes.LastModified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastModified.
Date lexicon was last modified (a timestamp value).

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes.LexemesCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LexemesCount.
Number of lexemes in the lexicon.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes.LexiconArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LexiconArn.
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the lexicon.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconAttributes.Size
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Size.
Total size of the lexicon, in characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconDescription
member.summary: Describes the content of the lexicon.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconDescription.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
Provides lexicon metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.LexiconDescription.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Name of the lexicon.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.PutLexiconRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutLexicon operation. Stores a pronunciation lexicon in an AWS Region. If a lexicon with the same name already exists in the region, it is overwritten by the new lexicon. Lexicon operations have eventual consistency, therefore, it might take some time before the lexicon is available to the SynthesizeSpeech operation.
For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.PutLexiconRequest.Content
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Content.
Content of the PLS lexicon as string data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.PutLexiconRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Name of the lexicon. The name must follow the regular express format [0-9A-Za-z]{1,20}. That is, the name is a case-sensitive alphanumeric string up to 20 characters long.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.PutLexiconResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutLexicon operation.

member.summary: Constructs a new ServiceFailureException with the specified error message.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the SynthesizeSpeech operation. Synthesizes UTF-8 input, plain text or SSML, to a stream of bytes. SSML input must be valid, well-formed SSML. Some alphabets might not be available with all the voices (for example, Cyrillic might not be read at all by English voices) unless phoneme mapping is used. For more information, see How it Works.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.LexiconNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LexiconNames.
List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. For information about storing lexicons, see PutLexicon.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.OutputFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputFormat.
The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.SampleRate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SampleRate.
The audio frequency specified in Hz.
The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050".
Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.SpeechMarkTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SpeechMarkTypes.
The type of speech marks returned for the input text.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
Input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.TextType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TextType.
Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text. For more information, see Using SSML.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest.VoiceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VoiceId.
Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of available voice IDs by calling the DescribeVoices operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechResponse.AudioStream
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AudioStream.
Stream containing the synthesized speech.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechResponse.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request.
If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg.
If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg.
If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.
If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechResponse.RequestCharacters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestCharacters.
Number of characters synthesized.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Gender.
Gender of the voice.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.Voice.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
Amazon Polly assigned voice ID. This is the ID that you specify when calling the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

member.summary:

Language code of the voice.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.Voice.LanguageName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageName.
Human readable name of the language in English.

member.name: P:Amazon.Polly.Model.Voice.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Name of the voice (for example, Salli, Kendra, etc.). This provides a human readable voice name that you might display in your application.

member.name: T:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Polly
Amazon Polly is a web service that makes it easy to synthesize speech from text.
The Amazon Polly service provides API operations for synthesizing high-quality speech from plain text and Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML), along with managing pronunciations lexicons that enable you to get the best results for your application domain.

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPollyClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPollyClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPollyClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The AmazonPollyClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.CreateSigner
member.summary: Creates the signer for the service.

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.DeleteLexicon(Amazon.Polly.Model.DeleteLexiconRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. A lexicon which has been deleted is not available for speech synthesis, nor is it possible to retrieve it using either the GetLexicon or ListLexicon APIs.
For more information, see Managing Lexicons.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteLexicon service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteLexicon service method, as returned by Polly.
member.exception:
Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.
Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.
An unknown condition has caused a service failure.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteLexicon Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.DeleteLexiconAsync(Amazon.Polly.Model.DeleteLexiconRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the DeleteLexicon operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteLexicon operation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteLexicon Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.DescribeVoices(Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the list of voices that are available for use when requesting speech synthesis. Each voice speaks a specified language, is either male or female, and is identified by an ID, which is the ASCII version of the voice name.
When synthesizing speech ( SynthesizeSpeech ), you provide the voice ID for the voice you want from the list of voices returned by DescribeVoices.
For example, you want your news reader application to read news in a specific language, but giving a user the option to choose the voice. Using the DescribeVoices operation you can provide the user with a list of available voices to select from.
You can optionally specify a language code to filter the available voices. For example, if you specify en-US, the operation returns a list of all available US English voices.
This operation requires permissions to perform the polly:DescribeVoices action.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeVoices service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeVoices service method, as returned by Polly.
member.exception: The NextToken is invalid. Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.
An unknown condition has caused a service failure.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeVoices Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.DescribeVoicesAsync(Amazon.Polly.Model.DescribeVoicesRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the DescribeVoices operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeVoices operation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeVoices Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.GetLexicon(Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconRequest)
member.summary: Returns the content of the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetLexicon service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetLexicon service method, as returned by Polly.
member.exception:
Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.
Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.
An unknown condition has caused a service failure.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetLexicon Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.GetLexiconAsync(Amazon.Polly.Model.GetLexiconRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the GetLexicon operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetLexicon operation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetLexicon Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.ListLexicons(Amazon.Polly.Model.ListLexiconsRequest)
member.summary: Returns a list of pronunciation lexicons stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListLexicons service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListLexicons service method, as returned by Polly.
member.exception: The NextToken is invalid. Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.
An unknown condition has caused a service failure.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ListLexicons Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.ListLexiconsAsync(Amazon.Polly.Model.ListLexiconsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the ListLexicons operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListLexicons operation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ListLexicons Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.PutLexicon(Amazon.Polly.Model.PutLexiconRequest)
member.summary:
Stores a pronunciation lexicon in an AWS Region. If a lexicon with the same name already exists in the region, it is overwritten by the new lexicon. Lexicon operations have eventual consistency, therefore, it might take some time before the lexicon is available to the SynthesizeSpeech operation.
For more information, see Managing Lexicons.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutLexicon service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutLexicon service method, as returned by Polly.
member.exception: Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. Verify that the lexicon's name is spelled correctly, and then try again.
The maximum size of the specified lexicon would be exceeded by this operation.
The maximum size of the lexeme would be exceeded by this operation.
The maximum number of lexicons would be exceeded by this operation.
An unknown condition has caused a service failure.
The alphabet specified by the lexicon is not a supported alphabet. Valid values are x-sampa and ipa.
The language specified in the lexicon is unsupported. For a list of supported languages, see Lexicon Attributes.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutLexicon Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.PutLexiconAsync(Amazon.Polly.Model.PutLexiconRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the PutLexicon operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutLexicon operation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutLexicon Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.SynthesizeSpeech(Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest)
member.summary: Synthesizes UTF-8 input, plain text or SSML, to a stream of bytes. SSML input must be valid, well-formed SSML. Some alphabets might not be available with all the voices (for example, Cyrillic might not be read at all by English voices) unless phoneme mapping is used. For more information, see How it Works.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SynthesizeSpeech service method.
member.returns: The response from the SynthesizeSpeech service method, as returned by Polly.
member.exception: The specified sample rate is not valid.
The SSML you provided is invalid. Verify the SSML syntax, spelling of tags and values, and then try again.

Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.
Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.
Speech marks are not supported for the OutputFormat selected. Speech marks are only available for content in json format.
An unknown condition has caused a service failure.
SSML speech marks are not supported for plain text-type input.

The value of the "Text" parameter is longer than the accepted limits. The limit for input text is a maximum of 3000 characters total, of which no more than 1500 can be billed characters. SSML tags are not counted as billed characters.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SynthesizeSpeech Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Polly.AmazonPollyClient.SynthesizeSpeechAsync(Amazon.Polly.Model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the SynthesizeSpeech operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SynthesizeSpeech operation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SynthesizeSpeech Operation

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SynthesizeSpeech Operation
